content.text: gen ra cho t√¥i c√°i giao di·∫πn cua categories crud ƒë·∫πp d·ª±a v√†o nh∆∞ng giao di·∫πn tr∆∞·ªõc trong code c·ªßa t√¥i gen ra ƒë·∫πp nha

To create a visually appealing CRUD interface for categories in your JavaFX application, we can draw inspiration from the existing `Products.fxml` file. Here's a refined version of your `categories.fxml` file, incorporating a modern design with enhanced usability:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<?import javafx.scene.control.Button?>
<?import javafx.scene.control.Label?>
<?import javafx.scene.control.TableColumn?>
<?import javafx.scene.control.TableView?>
<?import javafx.scene.control.TextField?>
<?import javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane?>
<?import javafx.scene.layout.HBox?>
<?import javafx.scene.layout.VBox?>

<AnchorPane xmlns="http://javafx.com/javafx"
            xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml"
            fx:controller="views.products.Categories"
            prefHeight="600.0" prefWidth="800.0"
            style="-fx-background-color: linear-gradient(to bottom, #F5F5DC, #E8D5B7);">

    <!-- Header -->
    <VBox alignment="CENTER" spacing="15" style="-fx-background-color: linear-gradient(135deg, #8B4513 0%, #A0522D 50%, #CD853F 100%); -fx-padding: 20;">
        <Label style="-fx-font-size: 32px; -fx-font-weight: bold; -fx-text-fill: #FFF8DC;" text="QU·∫¢N L√ù DANH M·ª§C" />
    </VBox>

    <!-- Main Content -->
    <VBox layoutY="80.0" spacing="20" style="-fx-padding: 20;">
        <!-- Search and Actions -->
        <HBox alignment="CENTER_LEFT" spacing="15">
            <TextField fx:id="txtSearchCategory" promptText="üîç T√¨m ki·∫øm danh m·ª•c..." style="-fx-background-radius: 25; -fx-border-color: #D2B48C; -fx-border-radius: 25; -fx-border-width: 2; -fx-padding: 12 20 12 20; -fx-font-size: 15px; -fx-background-color: #FAFAFA;" />
            <Button style="-fx-background-color: linear-gradient(to bottom, #87CEEB, #4682B4); -fx-text-fill: white; -fx-font-weight: bold; -fx-background-radius: 15; -fx-pref-width: 120; -fx-pref-height: 35;" text="üîÑ L√†m m·ªõi" />
        </HBox>

        <!-- Categories Table -->
        <TableView fx:id="tableCategories" prefHeight="400" style="-fx-background-color: #FAFAFA; -fx-background-radius: 15; -fx-border-color: #D2B48C; -fx-border-radius: 15; -fx-border-width: 2;">
            <columns>
                <TableColumn fx:id="colCategoryId" prefWidth="100" text="ID" />
                <TableColumn fx:id="colCategoryName" prefWidth="300" text="T√™n danh m·ª•c" />
                <TableColumn fx:id="colCategoryDescription" prefWidth="400" text="M√¥ t·∫£" />
            </columns>
        </TableView>

        <!-- Action Buttons -->
        <HBox alignment="CENTER" spacing="15">
            <Button fx:id="btnAddCategory" style="-fx-background-color: linear-gradient(to bottom, #28a745, #218838); -fx-text-fill: white; -fx-font-weight: bold; -fx-background-radius: 15; -fx-pref-width: 130; -fx-pref-height: 45;" text="‚ûï TH√äM M·ªöI" />
            <Button fx:id="btnEditCategory" style="-fx-background-color: linear-gradient(to bottom, #ffc107, #e0a800); -fx-text-fill: white; -fx-font-weight: bold; -fx-background-radius: 15; -fx-pref-width: 130; -fx-pref-height: 45;" text="‚úèÔ∏è C·∫¨P NH·∫¨T" />
            <Button fx:id="btnDeleteCategory" style="-fx-background-color: linear-gradient(to bottom, #dc3545, #c82333); -fx-text-fill: white; -fx-font-weight: bold; -fx-background-radius: 15; -fx-pref-width: 130; -fx-pref-height: 45;" text="üóëÔ∏è X√ìA" />
        </HBox>
    </VBox>
</AnchorPane>
```

### Key Features:
- **Header**: A visually appealing header with a gradient background and bold text.
- **Search Bar**: A search bar for filtering categories.
- **Table**: A table to display category details with columns for ID, Name, and Description.
- **Action Buttons**: Buttons for adding, editing, and deleting categories, styled with gradients and shadows for a modern look.

This design maintains consistency with your existing product management interface while providing a clean and functional layout for managing categories.
